comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
About the same time (c.1895) as the other Woolloomooloo photo,  but different script on the title line (no small caps here).  Plot thickens!

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/8160300212/in/photostream]

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thanks for the map! Great resource, the Ladies Baths look dangerously close to the Men's though ;) Re the handwriting, there is something about this set of W Hall photos that seem a little out of place, perhaps some are the work of other photographers. Hall did have a number of employees over the years which may also account for differences in style & handwriting etc. This article about WJ Hall in trouble with the law also mentions employees: bit.ly/Uaajep An ad for help – Wanted an intelligent lad to learn the above business… SMH Thursday 13 June 1889 p12 bit.ly/WsGR7a A theft - an employee or commissioned worker? (Or plain crim?!): bit.ly/YMBa63
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
